field.name: CORRECT POSITIONING:
Show the mother how to hold her infant
with infant’s head and body straight
with the infant facing her breast with nose opposite to the nipple
with the infant held close to the mother’s body
with the infant’s whole body supported, not just neck and shoulders.
Good Attachment
To make sure the child is attached well:
Touch the child’s lips to nipple
Wait until the child’s mouth open wide
Quickly bring breast from below, aiming nipple up towards the roof of the child’s mouth
The child should now take a big mouthful of breast (areola)
breast_attachment/breast_attachment1.jpg
The 4 signs of good attachment are:
The child’s mouth is wide open
Mother can see more of the darker skin (areola) above the child’s mouth than below
The child’s lower lip is turned outwards
The child’s chin is touching breast
breast_attachment/breast_attachment2.jpg
The signs of effective suckling are:
The child takes slow, deep suckles, sometimes pausing
You may be able to see or hear the child swallowing after 1 or 2 suckles
Suckling is comfortable and pain free for you
Your child finishes the feed, releases the breast and looks contented and relaxed
The breast is softer after the feed
breast_attachment/breast_attachment3.png

After your child releases one breast offer him/her child the other breast. This will make sure that your child stimulates your milk production in both breasts, and also gets the most nutritious and satisfying milk
